alert.note: Alert for Grand and Summit Counties Below 9000 Feet; Jackson County Below 9000 Feet; South and East Jackson, Larimer, North and Northeast Grand, Northwest Boulder Counties Above 9000 Feet (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 24 at 1:53PM MDT until August 25 at 12:00AM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT THROUGH EARLY SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...Portions of central and north central Colorado, including the following areas, in central Colorado, Grand and Summit Counties Below 9000 Feet. In north central Colorado, Jackson County Below 9000 Feet and South and East Jackson/Larimer/North and Northeast Grand/Northwest Boulder Counties Above 9000 Feet. * WHEN...Through late Friday night. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - A wave of showers and thunderstorms is expected to develop this afternoon and continue overnight tonight. Slow moving, training thunderstorms will be capable of producing rain rates in excess of one inch per hour. Additional rain is possible from late Friday morning through Friday night.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

area.areaDesc: Grand and Summit Counties Below 9000 Feet; Jackson County Below 9000 Feet; South and East Jackson, Larimer, North and Northeast Grand, Northwest Boulder Counties Above 9000 Feet
